article_title: Coverage of presidential campaigns in Poughkeepsie
article_text:
Buy Photo A "Vote Here" sign outside the Poughkeepsie Library in the City of Poughkeepsie on Tuesday. (Photo: Patrick Oehler/Poughkeepsie Journal)Buy Photo

New York has mattered in this spring's presidential primary cycle. For results of today's Primary election, check our site later.

Three presidential campaigns visited Dutchess County in the last week.

On April 12, Democratic candidate Bernie Sanders appeared at Marist College in Poughkeepsie. Former REM frontman Michael Stipe introduced Sanders, who blamed income inequality and economic hardship on Wall Street greed and cost-prohibitive college education.

On Sunday, Chelsea Clinton came to CSEA in Poughkeepsie for a "get out the vote" event for her mother, Democratic candidate Hillary Clinton. Clinton told those in attendance for the "get out the vote" event that her mother plans to continue Obama’s efforts at expanding health care and the Affordable Care Act.

On Sunday, Republican candidate Donald Trump appeared at Mid-Hudson Civic Center in Poughkeepsie for a rally, offering a restorative vision of America's future that is secure and prosperous.

Republican candidates John Kasich visited the Albany area, while Ted Cruz stopped by Binghamton for a forum.

For complete coverage of this year's presidential election, check out the Elections 2016 page from the USA TODAY Network.

Read or Share this story: http://pojonews.co/1U5MeZZ
